F* 0 • 1= ****• Description of Enclosure. Nome, Date, etc. From: Political Headquarters, East Africa Command Nairobi, File No. 937/8 of 21/10/41. Subject. Alleged sinking of an Iranian dhow by a British ship off the coast of Somalia. RECte. POL. OEPt. f 19 NOV .941 INDIA OFFICENAIROBI. ^ 2lBt October, 1941. Sir, I have the honour to acknowledge receipt of a copy of a letter dated the 26th September 1941 addressed by H.B.M. Ambassador, Cairo, to the T ight Honourable Mr. Anthony hden, together with a copy of a despatch from His Majesty's Minister at Teheran, regarding the alleged sinking of an Iranian dhow by a British ship off the coast of Somalia, and to inform you that I have caused enquiries to be made into this matter, through the Military Administrator, Somalia, who replies that he is unable to trace any information on this incident. I have, etc., (Signed) For Major-Oeneral CHIEF POLITICAL OFFICER. The First Secretary, British mbassy, CAIRO.K 664S/9S5/34 FORkTOfr OF FTC K 2lst October^ 1941 . ^ . . ii • 4 • 1 • secretary to be laid before the tor eta (omaiseioners of the Admiralty, a co^y of a despatch froa Hlfi Majesty*a ^Tibaaeador at Cairo, enclosing correspondence fron His Malesty’a Hlnlater at Tehran regarding an alleged Incident in which a Persian dhoe and one of His HalesV '■ ships areaaid to hare been involved. The incident is eta ted to have taken place on the 8th February, ,1941» in the vicinity of Kianayu.. 2 . location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Ext 6739/41 ‘Alleged sinking of a Persian dhow by one of H.M. Ships’

physicalDescription.extent: The papers are arranged in approximate chronological order from the rear to the front of the file.

Foliation: the foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1, and terminates at the inside back cover with 8; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio.

mods.abstract: The file contains a small amount of correspondence on the alleged sinking of an Iranian dhow (registration plate No. L.44) by a Royal Naval vessel on 8 February 1941 off the coast of Somalia near the Port of Kismayu [Kismayo]. The particulars of the incident can be found in a translation of a memorandum from the Iranian Ministry of Foreign Affairs dated 17 August 1941: see folio 7.A list of correspondence references by year can be found on the front cover.
